args.description: Args overrides the container's CMD. Provide as an array of arguments (e.g., ["python", "app.py"])

autoscaling.description: Autoscaling configuration as key-value pairs. Example: {"metric": "QueueBacklogPerWorker", "target": "10"} to scale based on queue backlog

command.description: Command overrides the container's ENTRYPOINT. Provide as an array (e.g., ["/bin/sh", "-c"])

cpu.description: CPU is the number of CPU cores to allocate per container instance (e.g., 0.1 = 100 milli cores)

description.description: Description is an optional human-readable description of your deployment

environment_variables.description: EnvironmentVariables is a list of environment variables to set in the container. This will replace all existing environment variables

name.description: Name is the environment variable name (e.g., "DATABASE_URL"). Must start with a letter or underscore, followed by letters, numbers, or underscores

value.description: Value is the plain text value for the environment variable. Use this for non-sensitive values. Either Value or ValueFromSecret must be set, but not both

value_from_secret.description: ValueFromSecret references a secret by name or ID to use as the value. Use this for sensitive values like API keys or passwords. Either Value or ValueFromSecret must be set, but not both

gpu_count.description: GPUCount is the number of GPUs to allocate per container instance

gpu_type.description: GPUType specifies the GPU hardware to use (e.g., "h100-80gb")

health_check_path.description: HealthCheckPath is the HTTP path for health checks (e.g., "/health"). Set to empty string to disable health checks

image.description: Image is the container image to deploy from registry.together.ai.

max_replicas.description: MaxReplicas is the maximum number of replicas that can be scaled up to.

memory.description: Memory is the amount of RAM to allocate per container instance in GiB (e.g., 0.5 = 512MiB)

min_replicas.description: MinReplicas is the minimum number of replicas to run

name.description: Name is the new unique identifier for your deployment. Must contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, or hyphens (1-100 characters)

port.description: Port is the container port your application listens on (e.g., 8080 for web servers)

storage.description: Storage is the amount of ephemeral disk storage to allocate per container instance (e.g., 10 = 10GiB)

termination_grace_period_seconds.description: TerminationGracePeriodSeconds is the time in seconds to wait for graceful shutdown before forcefully terminating the replica

volumes.description: Volumes is a list of volume mounts to attach to the container. This will replace all existing volumes

mount_path.description: MountPath is the path in the container where the volume will be mounted (e.g., "/data")

name.description: Name is the name of the volume to mount. Must reference an existing volume by name or ID
